meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Violence Continues in Somali Capital Somalia's transitional government responded to nighttime attacks with a series of raids in Mogadishu. There were also reports of airstrikes in the south, where Islamist forces have retreated.
PAGE A21

The House Goes Smoke-Free Democrats banned smoking inside the House, then quickly congratulated themselves, squeezing as much symbolism out of the moment as they could. ''The days of smoke-filled rooms in the United States Capitol are over,'' Speaker Nancy Pelosi declared.
PAGE A24

Ex-Official Focus of Inquiry The former No. 2 official in the Interior Department is said to have been notified that he will most likely be indicted for lying about his relationship with the corrupt lobbyist Jack Abramoff.
PAGE A27

Yvonne De Carlo Dies The actress, who had a prolific career as a Hollywood star before achieving her greatest popularity as the ghoulish housewife Lily in the television sitcom ''The Munsters,'' was 84.
PAGE B6

A Bit of Cellphone Magic Apple has uncloaked the iPhone, its long-awaited entry into the cellphone market, writes David Pogue in a review, but the cellphone may be the least interesting part. Still, despite its features, including a wide-screen iPod, it may not be a BlackBerry killer.
BUSINESS DAY, PAGE C1

Giants Are Keeping Coughlin Tom Coughlin will remain as the Giants' coach despite the team's late-season collapse and early playoff elimination by the Philadelphia Eagles. The team's owners retained Coughlin for 2007, the final year of his contract, and extended it into 2008.
SPORTSTHURSDAY, PAGE D1

Carlo Ponti, Filmmaker, Dies The producer, whose work encompassed Italian realism, French New Wave and Hollywood fluff but who etched his name in popular legend by defying law and church to marry Sophia Loren, was 94.
PAGE B7

Violence Continues in Somali Capital Somalia's transitional government responded to nighttime attacks with a series of raids in Mogadishu. There were also reports of airstrikes in the south, where Islamist forces have retreated.
PAGE A21

The House Goes Smoke-Free Democrats banned smoking inside the House, then quickly congratulated themselves, squeezing as much symbolism out of the moment as they could. ''The days of smoke-filled rooms in the United States Capitol are over,'' Speaker Nancy Pelosi declared.
PAGE A24

PAGE A27

PAGE B6

BUSINESS DAY, PAGE C1

Carlo Ponti, Filmmaker, Dies The producer, whose work encompassed Italian realism, French New Wave and Hollywood fluff but who etched his name in popular legend by defying law and church to marry Sophia Loren, was 94.
